definition: to cause to explode/to fire/to set off
to burn/to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes)/to start (debate)/to raise (hopes)
to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil

sentences.english: Unexploded ordnance and mines continue to take thousands of lives.
sentences.chinese: 未燃爆的军火和地雷仍在夺走无数人的生命。

definition: each new high point replaced by another/(of a movie etc) one climax after another
(slang) to battle each other in street dancing (derived from Taiwanese 較, which sounds similar to Mandarin 尬[ga4])/(slang) to perform weird dance moves
(slang) to cheer sb on/to show one's support/("call" is pronounced approximately like English "call")
the scene (of a crime, accident etc)/(on) the spot/(at) the site
to cook on a skewer/barbecued food on a skewer/shish kebab/(fig.) to perform or play songs in sequence/sequence of songs/medley
to burst out laughing/hilarious/burst of laughter
(neologism) (of movies, songs etc) affecting/touching/moving/(of a person, esp. a woman) charming/cool
